post.title: Delete pictures from i.ruqqus.com??

body:
Yep, that's why I meticulously strip metadata from pics that I upload and double-check before the upload.

Perhaps better than having a delete feature (which does not prevent users uploading images with metadata without knowing it in the first place) Ruqqus should strip that metadata from all uploaded content.
body_html:
Yep, that's why I meticulously strip metadata from pics that I upload and double-check before the upload.

Perhaps better than having a delete feature (which does not prevent users uploading images with metadata without knowing it in the first place) Ruqqus should strip that metadata from all uploaded content.

post.body: How do you do this?? I’ll explain why this is  necessary And why it is a really big security issue with posting pics to ruqqus after learning how to delete pics
post.body_html: How do you do this?? I’ll explain why this is necessary And why it is a really big security issue with posting pics to ruqqus after learning how to delete pics
post.title: Delete pictures from i.ruqqus.com??

body:
Exactly. I use jhead for that, it’s cryptic and a pain but it’s serviceable. I’m sure there are easier programs to use that jhead now. But how many people know how to do that shit??

And ruqqus should absolutely be removing metadata from uploads automatically. And they need to go back and strip files already in their library. I’ve been playing with it and I’ve recovered metadata from a number of uploads and some of them include location data. This is a really gigantic security and privacy issue.
body_html:
Exactly. I use jhead for that, it’s cryptic and a pain but it’s serviceable. I’m sure there are easier programs to use that jhead now. But how many people know how to do that shit??

And ruqqus should absolutely be removing metadata from uploads automatically. And they need to go back and strip files already in their library. I’ve been playing with it and I’ve recovered metadata from a number of uploads and some of them include location data. This is a really gigantic security and privacy issue.

body: I agree. Admins are not the strongest on security. They wrongly think that non-discriminately upgrading HTTP links to HTTPS somehow protects users and overlook compromising metadata leakage.
body_html: I agree. Admins are not the strongest on security. They wrongly think that non-discriminately upgrading HTTP links to HTTPS somehow protects users and overlook compromising metadata leakage.

body: I tested that theory. If you go to the url for the picture on i.ruqqus.com it is still there. To test whether my browser was displaying a cached copy of the image I typed the url into a different browser on a different computer and the image comes up. So deleting the post deletes the link so the image is for all practical purposes inaccessible unless you have the long, cryptic url handy but it’s still there.
body_html: I tested that theory. If you go to the url for the picture on i.ruqqus.com it is still there. To test whether my browser was displaying a cached copy of the image I typed the url into a different browser on a different computer and the image comes up. So deleting the post deletes the link so the image is for all practical purposes inaccessible unless you have the long, cryptic url handy but it’s still there.
